description.narrative: The project aims to assist the Government of Iraq (GoI) to restore the legitimacy of the countrys institutions and to renew the social contract between citizens and state in a context of fractured and sectarian governance

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative:
Output 1: Selected Governorates are able to manage effectively and transparently local government 1.1 # of citizens confidence increase in local government at governorate level 1.2 Number of Performance-based revenues’ assessments mechanisms performed by UNDP on Local Authorities 1.3 Donor coordination mechanisms established in each Governorates as well as at regional and national level.
Output 2: Economic growth and job opportunities have increased in selected Governorates, with special focus on green projects involving youth and women 2.1 Percentage increase in Local Human Development Index (LHDI ) for the target governorates 2.2 Percentage of beneficiaries of VET training who find employment within 6 months is increased
Output 3: Living conditions in conflict areas have improved and returnees are assisted 3.1 Number of returnees living in critical/inadequate shelter or temporary accommodations in conflict affected areas 3.2 Number of beneficiaries assisted in their return (disaggregated by sex and age)

OUTPUT 1:
Target 1.1.1. By 2022, 9 gap assessments conducted (1 per Governorate) Target 1.1.2. By 2022, 9 gap plugging actions undertaken (1 per Governorate). Target 1.1.3. By 2021, 9 Peer-to-peer partnerships established (1 per Governorate) Target 1.2.1. By 2022, 2 databases – governorate and regional Target 1.3.1. 5 governorates engaged in developing and testing electronic fee collection systems by 2022. Target 1.3.2. Cashless payment system(s) piloted in 2 target Governorates by 2022 Target 1.3.3. 50 local officials trained on revenue generation by 2022 Target 1.4.1. By 2022, at least 1 local development priorities related to COVID -19 addressed implemented and monitored with the support of this Action per Governorate Target 1.4.2. By 2022, 60 CSO projects implemented in the targeted governorates Target 1.4.3. By 2022, On line multimedia Forum established.
OUTPUT 2: Economic growth and job opportunities, with special focus on green projects involving youth and women; have increased in selected Governorates. Target 2.1.1. By 2022, 9 projects implemented Target 2.1.2. By 2022, 3000 jobs created Target 2.1.3. By 2022, 9 awareness campaigns Target 2.2.1. Yes (created)
OUTPUT 3: Living conditions in conflict areas have improved and returnees are assisted. Target 3.1.1. 600 houses rehabilitated by 2022 in 3 governorates Target 3.1.2. 10 public facilities rehabilitated by 2022 Target 3.1.3. Over 5,000 households have improved access to safe water by 2022 Target 3.1.4. At least 5 public green spaces redesigned, landscaped and equipped by 2022 Target 3.1.5. 200 youth engaged by 2022 (50% female, 50% male) Target 3.2.1. At least 400 unemployed men and women enrolled in vocational training courses in 3 governorates by 2021. Target 3.2.2. 1,000 labour/months created by 2021 Target 3.2.3. 3 training modules delivered to local authorities and academics in 3 governorates in 2020; Curriculum developed by 2021. Target 3.2.4. Set up of academic course on building innovation and green technology by 2022. Target 3.2.5. Competition among youth on building innovation and green technologies by 2021 Target 3.2.6. Over 6,000 people reached by awareness-raising campaign by 2021

Output.1.1: Result 1.1.1: 5 gap assessments conducted in 5 Governorates; Result 1.1.2: 5 gap plugging actions initiated; Result 1.1.3: 8 partnerships established;
Output1.2: Donor coordination Result 1.2.1: Zero
Output 1.3:- Optimized Governorates’ revenue generation systems piloted Result 1.3.1:- 1.3.1: Two (2) local authorities (Erbil and Sulaymaniyah) are in preparation of MoU with MoMT and setting a steering and technical committee Result 1.3.2: Zero Result 1.3.4: Zero
Output 1.4:- Strengthened dialogue between local authorities and civil society Result 1.4.1: Development priorities related to COVID-19 implemented in six governorates (‘Let’s Beat Corona’ in Anbar, Basra, Missan, Ninewa, ThiQar, Sala-al Din) Result 1.4.2: Implementation of 16 CSO projects ongoing in 9 Governorates; Result 1.4.3: Not in place
Output 2.1: Local development projects and priority actions implemented deriving from PDPs and SEAPs Result 2.1.1: 6 projects under implementation by UNDP (+3 by UN-Habitat) Result 2.1.2: 163 Result 2.1.3: One awareness campaign on Gender Based Violence implemented
Output 2.2:- Piloting mechanism aimed at mobilizing additional funding Result 2.2.1: Zero
Output.3.1:- Damaged houses, public facilities rehabilitated in post-conflict areas, in line with the 2018 PRPs Result 3.1.1: 287 houses weather-proofed / rehabilitated, including WASH facilities in Mosul, Heet and Yathrib. Result 3.1.2: 6 public facilities rehabilitated - including emergency clinic and 1 WTP in Yathrib + a school and 2 WTPs in Heet + community hall in Mosul Result 3.1.3: 6,199 households connected to improved portable water infrastructure; 13,000 people benefiting from the rehabilitation of EC-9 irrigation canal in Yathrib; Result 3.1.4: 2 newly landscaped multi-functional public spaces created in Heet and Yathrib and one under rehabilitation in Mosul (incl. 6 new sports facilities for youth); over 2,500 new trees and plants planted in the new parks. Result 3.1.5: Over 500 children and youth engaged in projects’ design and implementation
Output 3.2: On-the-job vocational training delivered and jobs for youth created in line with greener and safer construction technologies Result 3.2.1. Over 460 youth trained in vocational training – including 30 unemployed and disadvantaged women enrolled in horticultural training course and 30 in Heet. In 3 cities Result 3.2.2.: Over 970 labour/months for skilled and unskilled laborer’s in local projects, as of 31/03/21. Result 3.2.3.- 3 iterations of 2-day Green Building Training delivered in Mosul, Heet and Yathrib to a total of 42 public officials. In 2021 Result 3.2.4: None Result 3.2.5.: 2 competitions in Mosul university conducted (1 in innovative building and 1 in environmental subjects in the Mosul curriculum) Over 50 students participated in the competition. Result 3.2.6.: Over 1,000 had attended in the event of engineering week for building innovation and green building in Mosul university
